loans.name: Marady

texts.en: Marady was born in 1988. She is married and has 3 children. Marady has been selling clothes and blankets to her neighbors for three years. She considers her work to be a good source of income to support her husband and children in improving their living conditions. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales and profit. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize and leaves to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Na'eem

texts.en:
Na'eem is 19 years old, and he lives in Gaza. He stopped his education at grade 10, because of his hard life conditions.  He decided to open a garage, and has four years of courses in this field. Na'eem specializes in painting and repairing vehicles. This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Na'eem is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this youth loan to buy a blacksmith machine and new painting tools. Na'eem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a blacksmith machine and new painting tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large quantities of bread, milo, and eggs, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 18 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 6 siblings and his parents. His father is a bus driver who also works in data entry.

Mohammad is studying for a bachelor's degree majoring in computer engineering. He is in his 1st year. He is planning to continue his study to find a good job in his study field after graduation to start helping his parents financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of frozen chicken and meat, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of maize and leaves to help improve her sales of kenkey

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel de 22 años de edad, es una persona que estudio noveno grado,  debido al poco recurso económico no pudo seguir estudiando y otro factor fue la distancia; ya que solo para llegar al Instituto más cercano está a 22 kilómetros. Hoy en día está acompañada,  su esposo trabaja como albañil y en la agricultura. Han procreado una hija de siete años de edad, que asiste a la escuela que está a una distancia de ½ kilómetro.
 
Maribel se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, el negocio lo realiza desde hace cuatro años, la ropa la compra en la capital y la vende en las comunidades de los alrededores; el trabajo lo hace tres días a la semana, eso si cuando sale lo hace todo el día y algunas veces también le paga a otra persona para que le acompañe. 
 
El préstamo solicitado a fundación campo, es para comprar madera para cambiar el techo de la casa,  ya que esta inservible y no se puede habitar.  También invertirá en más mercadería,  comprara otros productos que no tiene como lo son yinas y sandalias.

El sueño de Maribel,  es tener su propio local de venta de ropa en un mercado, donde pueda desempeñar mejor el trabajo sin mucho riesgo, y siempre pensando en que la hija pueda estudiar hasta verla una profesional.
texts.en:
Maribel is 22 years old and studied up to the 9th grade. Because of a lack of economic resources she was not able to keep studying, distance also playing a factor since the closest high school was 22 kilometres away. She is now married, her husband working as a bricklayer and farmer. They have a seven-year-old girl, who goes to school ½ kilometre away.

Maribel makes a living from the purchase and sale of clothes. She has been doing this for four years. She buys clothes in the capital and sells it in the neighbouring communities. She works three days a week, but when she does, she does it for the entire day, sometimes also paying another person to go with her.

The loan requested to Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood to change the roof of her house, since it is unworkable and uninhabitable. She will also invest in more merchandise, buying other products that she does not have, such as flip-flops and sandals.

Maribel's dream is to have her own clothing stall in a market, where she can do a better job without much risk, always thinking of her daughter, so that one day she can see her becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy wood to change the roof of her house, since it is unworkable and uninhabitable. She will also invest in more merchandise, buying other products that she does not have, such as flip-flops and sandals.

loans.name: Maycon Yakson

texts.es: Maycon, tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, y reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace dos años en busca de obtener mas ingresos, decidió tener una venta de productos básicos alimenticios como arroz, manteca, sal, café, pan, condimentos, verduras, productos enlatados y abarrotes. Este negocio lo administra junto con su esposa. El presta los servicios de capataz en una hacienda cerca donde vive y en los tiempos libres ayuda en el negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de productos como granos básicos, jabón, azúcar, pan, arroz, frijoles, café, sal, condimentos etc. y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. El objetivo es obtener mas ingresos para arreglar su casa y para que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Maycon is 29 years old. He is married and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Two years ago, in search of a way to make more money, he decided to sell basic food products like rice, lard, salt, cafe, bread, condiments, vegetables canned goods and groceries. He runs the business with his wife. He works as an overseer on a farm close to where they live and in his spare time he helps in the store.

Maycon is requesting a loan for 15,000 HNL to stock his business with basic grains, soap, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, salt, condiments, etc. to be able to offer more variety to his clients. His goal is to make more income to fix up his house and for his children's studies.

loans.use: to stock his business with basic grains, soap, sugar, bread, rice, beans, salt, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of limes.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
В селе все знают Александра. Он очень оптимистично смотрит на свою жизнь, всегда в хорошем настроении, хороший семьянин. Его семья очень гостеприимная. Александр отличный хозяин, он никогда не сидит на месте, постоянно трудится. За 20 лет сумел развить большое хозяйство, у него  много больших высокопроизводительных теплиц. В теплицах Александр выращивает ранние овощи, такие как редис, помидоры, огурцы; при этом за год он собирает три урожая.

В этом году  осенний урожай не удался, было холодно, поэтому меньше заработали. 
Александр решил обратиться за кредитом. На полученные 40,000 гривен он приобретет котел для теплицы под рассаду, семена, пленку. Осталось не так много времени, в декабре будут уже сеять семена для нового сезона, поэтому Александр старается всё подготовить заранее.
texts.en:
Everyone in his village knows Alexander.  He has a very optimistic outlook on life, is always in a good mood, and is a good family man.  His family is very warm and welcoming.  Alexander is an excellent businessman.  He never just sits around, rather he works constantly.  Over the last 20 years, he has been able to build up a large farm and he has many highly productive greenhouses.  He raises early vegetables like radish, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and he reaps three harvests a year.

Because it was cold this year, the autumn harvest was unsuccessful and he earned less than usual.  And so, Alexander has decided to apply for a loan.  With the 40,000 hryvni (UAH) he receives, he will buy plastic greenhouse film, seed, and a boiler for the greenhouses where he raises seedlings.  There isn't much time left since planting for the next season goes on in December and Alexander tries to have everything ready in advance.

loans.use: to install heating, and purchase film and seeds for his greenhouses

loans.use: to purchase more maize, which will aid her in improving her kenkey sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for women, men, children and a some imitation jewellery

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes and blankets to raise her sales and profit, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.name: Los Castro Los Encuentros Group

texts.es:
Marta es  una señora casada de 52 años de edad, quien vive junto a su esposo y sus doce hijos en el Departamento de Sololá. Actualmente doña Marta es la representante del Grupo Los Castro Los Encuentros, ella se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la fotografía.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Comenta  que ahora se dedica a la compraventa de zapatos de cuero, en un negocio que tiene a pocos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad ya que en su comunidad no existe un negocio de este tipo, es por ello que tomo la iniciativa desde hace 7 años de realizar esta labor. A través de lo que realiza obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir con los gastos de su familia. 

Ahora ha decidido conformar un grupo de mujeres para que ellas puedan contribuir con la economía de sus familias. Por tal razón están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de zapatos que servirá para la ampliación del negocio y de esta manera podrán mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Uno de sus mayores sueños es sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios para que más adelante tengan mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Marta is a married woman of 52 years old. She lives with her husband and 12 children in the department of Sololá. She is the representative of the group "Los Castro Los Encuentros". She is in the center of the photograph.

She is a hard-working woman who fights for the well-being of her family. She comments that she works in buying and selling leather shoes, in a location a few meters from her house. She chose this field as there wasn't this kind of business in her community. So 7 years ago she started her business. Through this she has been able to generate good revenue which help to contribute to the finances of her family.

For this reason she decided to join a group of woman so that they can contribute to the finances of their families. For this reason Marta is requesting a loan to buy shoes to expand her business and in this way improve the living conditions of her family. One of her mains dreams is to get her children ahead in their studies so that they have better opportunities in society.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

texts.en:
Because Najah is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. 

Najah was born in 1966. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her husband and their seven children. Her husband is a retired man.

One of Najah’s sons is studying for a Bachelor of Accounting degree. He is in his last year and is planning to work in his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. He is one step closer to reaching his goal. 

But Najah doesn’t have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jesus De Navidad

texts.es:
Jesús de Navidad tiene un grado de estudio primaria completa y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de dinero debido que sus padres no tenían los suficientes ingresos para que ella continuara estudiando, que además tenía que viajar a otro municipio. Su padre falleció cuando ella tenía 8 años al fallecer a ella le toco la responsabilidad de los hermanos menores ya que para poder mantenerlos ella viajaba hasta otro municipio para vender verduras y comprarles la alimentación. Después a los años ella encontró una persona con la cual se acompañó y actualmente tiene cuatro hijos y todos se involucran en las actividades de la agricultura para cada cosecha, el primero tiene 17 años y solo llego hasta sexto grado esto porque no le gusto el estudio y mejor se dedicó a trabajar con el papa la tierra, la segunda tiene 16 años y solo llego hasta sexto grado ella se involucra en los quehaceres domésticos de la casa, el tercero tiene 14 años y solo llego hasta quinto grado ya que no le gusto el estudio y al igual que su hermano mayor él se involucra en el campo y el cuarto tiene 10 años y estudia en la escuela de la aldea cursa el tercer grado. Ella tiene 1 manzanas en total y la compraron haciendo un esfuerzo ya que también trabajan en otras fincas. Todos se involucran al momento de la corta de café; pero el desafío que ella tiene es que el precio baje en el mercado y que el intermediario no se lo compre a un precio muy bajo ya que ella hace todo el proceso del café.
Jesús de Navidad tiene como meta mejorar su cultivo para obtener más ingresos económicos mejorando más su propiedad y poderla heredar a sus hijos ya que no les gusto el estudio y así puedan trabajar y construir sus hogares.
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas ya que tiene 1 manzana de tierra cultivada y pueda obtener y generar los ingresos esperados para ir fortaleciendo sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Jesus de Navidad has a first grade education.  She was not able to continue in school because of a lack of money, as her parents did not have enough money for her to continue to study.  Also, she had to move to another town.  Her father died when she was 8 years old.  Upon his death, it fell to her to take over responsibility for her younger siblings.  In order to support them, she used to travel to other towns to sell vegetables and to buy them food.  After some years she found a partner, and now she has 4 children, all of whom are involved in agricultural activities for every harvest.  Her oldest child is 17 years old.  He only finished 6th grade because he didn't like to study, and so it was best for him to work the land with his father.  They also have a 16 year-old daughter who also left school after 6th grade.  She works on the domestic household chores.  Their third child is 14 years old.  Like their oldest, he did not enjoy school and so left after 5th grade to work in the fields.  Their youngest child is 10 years old and is attending a local school.  He is in the third grade.  

Jesus de Navidad has 1 manzana (about 1.5 acres) of land which she and her partner obtained through a lot of hard work, as they both also work on other farms.  Everyone in the family gets involved during the time that they harvest the coffee.  One challenge that she faces is that the price is falling in the market, and that the wholesalers will buy her coffee at a low price, even though she does all of the processing of the coffee.  

Jesus de Navidad's goal is to improve her crops so that she can get more income, improve her property, and be able to leave it to her children.  This way, even though they didn't want to continue with their education, they can work the land and build their own homes.  She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, because she has land to cultivate, and this way she can generate the income she hopes for in order to accomplish her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей очень приятный, простой , трудолюбивый парень. Он живет со своей семьей в Каменке Днепровской на Украине. Занимается выращиванием овощей и дополнительно подрабатывает на своем авто перевозкой пассажиров.   

Этот год был для Алексея трудным, сильно заболела жена и лежала в больнице три месяца. Поэтому ему пришлось самому высаживать и растить овощи, а также смотреть за маленьким ребенком. Как ни старался Алексей, но все равно не всегда успевал всё делать вовремя, поэтому прибыль получил гораздо меньше, чем ожидал. Он не очень расстроился, главное что выздоровела жена и теперь все будет хорошо.

Алексей нуждается в  дополнительных средствах, чтобы провести отопление в теплицах, приобрести семена, пленку на будущий сезон.  Алексей уверен, что полученные средства помогут получить большую прибыль в следующем году и его семья не будет ни в чем нуждаться.
texts.en:
Alexei is a very pleasant, uncomplicated, and hardworking fellow.  He and his family live in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine.  He raises vegetables, and earns a supplemental income by offering taxi services.

This was a difficult year for Alexei.  His wife fell very ill and was in the hospital for three months.  Because of this, Alexei alone had to plant and raise the vegetables, as well as look after their young child.  No matter how hard he tried, Alexei couldn't do everything as quickly as it needed to be done, and so their profit was a lot smaller than he had expected.  But he's not unhappy about it because, most importantly, his wife recovered and now all will be well.

Alexei is in need of additional funds in order to install a heating system in his greenhouses, to buy seed and plastic greenhouse film for the coming season.  Alexei is sure that the loan will help him to earn a large profit next year and his family will need for nothing.

loans.use: to install a heating system for his green houses as well as buy greenhouse film and seeds

loans.name: Arek

texts.en:
Arek is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and his six children, four of whom attend primary school. The family lives in Aja, a Palestinian town in the northern West Bank, located 19 kilometers southwest of Jenin. According to the Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics, the town had a population of 5,055 in 2007. 

Arek asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy flagstones to pave his house and to paint his house. This loan will help him to take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to pave and paint his house

He wants to expand his enterprise by buying a larger number of car covers that are suitable for winter, in hopes of increasing his profits in order to support his family financially. However, he doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more car covers for his business

loans.name: Anowara

texts.en:
Anowara and her husband, Mafizul, and their three children are from the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both are uneducated, but know how to sign their names. All three children are studying in different classes. 


Anowara is a homemaker, but her husband is associated with the agricultural business. Her husband’s business income is not sufficient for their family, so she decided to start her own business and help her husband financially. 


In her locality, demand for milk is very high, so she decided to buy a cow and sell the milk in the market and make their family financially strong. Due to the lack of money, she is unable to purchase a cow and start her new business, so she applied for a loan. 


In the future, Anowara wants to give a higher education to their children by making a good profit from this business. She is a dedicated woman.  She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to sell milk in the market.

She is trying her best to improve her living conditions by supporting herself with the best education in order to find a better job where she can earn better income. 

But she doesn’t have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer was born in 1992. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her three siblings and her parents. One of her brothers works at a restaurant. 

Ghadeer has been selling clothes and cosmetic products for two years. She considers her work a good source of income to support her family financially. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes and cosmetic products to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Khitibala

texts.en:
Khitibala is a 42-year-old married lady, and her husband, Jagadish, is 55 years old. They have four children (two sons and two daughters). Her sons are pursuing their higher education and her daughters are married. 


Khitibala is a homemaker, and her husband is cycle van puller. Both of them are illiterate, but know how to sign their names. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to support their family. 


To make more income for her family, Khitibala decided to start her new business of potato cultivation, so she applied for a loan. They have their own vacant land, which is near their home. She used to work over there, but due to their financial condition, she couldn’t continue. Now, with this loan amount, she will buy potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivating potatoes and will sell them to the market.


Her future dream is to make their own pakka house (concrete house) with profit from her business, as now they live in a kachha house (house made up of mud and straw). She is very happy after becoming a member of BJS and is grateful to Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita lives at Tekatuli in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her three children and her husband, Naresh. Both Gita and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are receiving education. Their two sons are in class III (grade 3) and class V (grade 5) respectively, and the daughter is in class VII (grade 7). 


The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. Gita works hard every day, starting in the early morning. She also helps her husband in cultivation, yet she is unable to give financial support to her family, as the earnings of her husband are not sufficient to maintain their household expenses and their children's educational expenses. 


Gita learned about BJS and applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes on their own land. She is very hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable, as there is a great demand for potatoes in the local market. She is motivated to give her full effort to expand her cultivation business.


She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad que, actualmente se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues vende sombreros de manera ambulante en el área metropolitana y en los pueblos más cercanos, trabaja sola todos los días, pero sus ventas se incrementan con la llegada de las festividades y diferentes eventos que se realizan en el municipio donde reside; esto le ha permitido generar recursos para su sustento personal y para aportar a la economía de su familia. La cliente se caracteriza por ser una persona humilde y carismática, pero a la vez enérgica y decidida; esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del préstamo con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (sombreros) y pagar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; de esta forma podrá tener más variedad de artículos para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le dará la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas, especialmente en la temporada e fin de año que se aproxima, generando así mayor nivel de ganancias. Todo esto le abrirá las puertas a Daniela para lograr alcanzar su principal deseo que es tener una fábrica para elaborar los productos y paralelamente tener un punto de venta, que le genere rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young entrepreneur of 23 years, who has her own business which is selling hats door-to-door in her municipality and in the surrounding villages. She works every day but her sales increase with the coming of the festivals and different events that take place in her municipality. This allows her to make more revenue to support herself and contribute to the finances of the family.

Daniela is humble and charismatic but at the same time she is energetic and determined. This has prompted her to request a loan as she wants to buy stock (hats) wholesale and pay off a loan that she has. In this way she will have more variety of goods to satisfy the demands and tastes of her customers. This will increase her possibilities of improving her sales especially with the end of the year with it's higher sales is approaching. This should raise her level of revenue.

All this opens the doors for Daniela to achieve her main dream which is to have a factory to produce her products and also have a sales location that will generate profits and provide an economic stability so she can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stock (hats) wholesale and pay off an existing debt.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 28 years old and married. She has two children, ages 4 years and 6 years. She describes herself as a confident individual. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place to do business. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to add stocks of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to add stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Всю жизнь Сергей проработал рыбаком. Дома он выращивал овощи для своей сеьми. В этом ему помогали жена и сын. Два года  назад в их семье произошла трагедия, жена ушла к другому мужчине . Это было трудно пережить, но хорошей поддержкой  был сын, он остался  с ним. Сергей хороший отец и сын старается во всем походить на него, занимается тем же делом. Вместе они решили развивать свой сельскохозяйственный бизнес. 

В этом году  Сергей с сыном вырастили отличный урожай помидор; помидоры выросли  очень крупными и отличались качеством. Теперь Сергей решил провести отопление в теплицы, чтобы раньше высаживать рассаду. Поэтому он решил обратиться за кредитом. Получив кредит 25,000 гривен Сергей   в следующем году  сможет получить более ранний урожай и продавать свою продукцию по более выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Sergei worked his entire life as a fisherman.  At home, he raised vegetables for his family with the help of his wife and son.  Two years ago their family suffered a tragedy:  his wife left him for another man.  This was very difficult to live through, but his son remained with him and was a excellent source of support.  Sergei is an excellent father and his son tries to emulate him in everything, and is in the very same business.  Together, they decided to develop their farming business.

This year Sergei and his son raised an excellent crop of tomatoes.  The tomatoes were very large and were notable for their quality.  Now, Sergei has decided to install a heating system in the greenhouses so they will be able to plant their seedlings earlier in the year.  For this reason he has applied for a loan.  With a loan of 25,000 hryvni (UAH), next year Sergei will be able to reap the harvest earlier and to sell it for a higher price.

loans.use: to purchase and install a heating system for his greenhouses

loans.name: Maen

texts.en: Maen is 25 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with his six siblings and his parents. Maen is studying for a Bachelors’ degree, majoring in Monuments Science. He is in his fourth year. He is planning to continue his study to find a good job in his study field after graduation so that he can start helping his parents financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en:
Etidal was born in 1966. She is a retired woman living at a sector in Jordan called Salt with her husband and six children. Her husband works at an engineering company. 

Etidal's son is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Mechanical Engineering. He is in his second year. 

Her son is planning to find a job in his study field after graduation to start helping his family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a 42-year-old married woman from a small village of South Mouamari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband, Nagen, and two children (two sons).


Both Kabita and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Kabita works as a cook for another family, and her husband pulls a rickshaw. The earning is not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle and the expenses of the household.


Kabita chose BJS for this loan, as she wants to purchase a cow in order to sell milk and dairy products in the market. She hopes to earn a profit from this business, as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market. 


She needs to start this business to give additional financial support to her family. She wants to build a sanitary latrine with the profit earned from her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a dairy products business.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati, 36 years old, is a housewife. She lives with her husband, Hemanta, and two children in the village of Madhyapara in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have their own kachha house (a house made of straw, mud and bamboo). 


Arati read up to class X (grade 10). Her husband, Hemanta, is a motor mechanic. He has a small shop in their area. He earns for their family by repairing motor vehicles. Both her son and daughter go to school. They read in class V (grade 5) and class III (grade 3) respectively. 


Arati's husband's income does not provide them with sufficient money to run the family's needs. She still tries to overcome the obstacle life puts in her path by helping her husband. Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and her family.


She came to know that BJS gives loans to those who are always looking for opportunities to get on in life and provide a better future for their family through daily hard work. She took a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation on their small piece of land. She wants to sell the potatoes in the local market, where there is a great demand for this product.



Arati dreams to make a pacca house (brick-built) with the profit generated from this business.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy increased amounts of the items she sells, thus improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy large quantities of palm kernels, extractor machines and firewood for his palm oil business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more millet, sugar, and other ingredients, thus improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria, junto a su esposo se han propuesto mejorar su casa, ella labora para una Institucion del Estado y su espodo para una Fabrica Privada, entre los dos luchan dia a dia para salir adelante, el credito lo solicita para compra de Maya, Tuvos, y pagar mano de obra para terminar el muro de su casa y asi tener mayor seguridad en la vivienda, Agradece el apoyo que se la ha brindado y la confianza que Kiva y Afodenic han depositado con este nuevo financiamiento
texts.en: Maria and her husband have decided to improve their house.  Maria works for a state institution and her husband for a private company.  The two of them struggle together every day to get ahead.  Maria is seeking a loan to buy fencing and pipes and pay for labor to finish building the house's wall so they'll have more security.  They appreciate the support they've gotten and the trust Kiva and Afodenic have offered with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 20 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his 7 siblings and his parents. Ahmad is in his 3rd year of study for his Bachelor's degree in Class Teaching. He is planning to continue his studies and to find a job in his study field after graduation so he can start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn’t currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali, age 54, is from the small village of Satvendi in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and has two daughters. Her husband, Noyai, aged 52, is engaged in agriculture. Dipali received education up to class X (grade 10), and her husband is illiterate, but they are providing education to their daughters; they read in class VII (grade 7) and class II (grade 2).


They live in their own kachha house (straw, bamboo and mud-made). Dipali's husband’s earnings are hardly enough to cover food and household costs for the family of four. 


In order to generate income, Dipali plans to start a business of growing eggplant. She applied for the loan from BJS. With the loan amount, she will purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers and start cultivating eggplant, which is in great demand in the local market.


Dipali hopes her initiative will be lucrative and she will be able to increase family funds. She will be able to give her children a better education and a better future, and at the same time, meet the family’s expenses.


She is thankful to BJS as well as Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers to start a cultivation business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en: Kalpana is a 25-year-old married woman. She is a homemaker. Her husband, Nabin, age 30, is a cycle-van puller by profession and earns money by carrying goods and people. Both Kalpana and Nabin passed sixth standard (Grade 6). Kalpana is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both of them receive education. They read in class II (Grade 2) and class I (Grade 1) respectively. They live in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kachha (mud- and straw-made house). Kalpana needs a loan so that she can buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation and make a good profit from this business. She hopes to upgrade their financial condition and give a good upbringing to their children. There is a very good demand for potatoes in her area, so the business will be a lucrative one. They want to become financially successful from this business. Kalpana and her husband dream of upgrading their kachha house to a brick-built house. Her full thanks go to Belghoria Janakalyan Samity as well as to Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 36-year-old married woman from the village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She received education up to 9th standard (grade 9). She is blessed with two children, a son and a daughter. She gives education to them with great difficulty.  Her son reads in class VI (grade 6), and her daughter reads in class V (grade 5). 


Her husband, Subhas, 45 years old, is a worker in a jewelry shop. He read up to class X (grade 10). They live in their kachha house (a house made of bamboo, straw and mud).


Rina's husband is very tenacious and dedicated to his job. Yet his income is too low to run a family well, so, Rina tries to help her husband by doing her own business. Over the last three years, Rina has earned to help the family financially by providing clothing for resale. In particular, she purchases clothing (sarees, frocks, shirts, etc.) from the wholesale market and resells them in neighbouring villages. The income from this activity is very important, as by this she tries to manage the needs of her family.


Rina hopes to grow the business to get more profit, but she needs capital. She has come to know BJS gives loans to rural women, so she applied for a loan. Rina will purchase a new stock of clothing with the help of this loan. As winter is coming, people demand warm clothing.


The loan will greatly assist Rina to continue her retail business and satisfy her clients' needs.  At the same time, she will be able to improve the financial condition of her family and provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of clothing for selling in neighboring villages.

loans.name: Monarani

texts.en:
Monarani is a 43-year-old housewife. She received education up to class VIII (Grade 8). She lives with her husband, Monmotho, age 50, and their only son in their own pacca house (brick-built ) in the village Tekatuli, in Maynaguri, in the district Jalpaiguri. Monmotho received education up to 10th standard (Grade 10). Their son goes to school and reads in class XII (Grade 12).

Monarani's husband is a water supplier by profession. There is a scarcity of pure drinking water in their locality, so he purchases pure drinking water and delivers to different houses and shops. His earnings are hardly enough to cover food and household costs for their family, so Monarani wants to help her husband to expand the business. Due to lack of capital, she cannot expand their business, so she applied for a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS).

Monarani is a hardworking and sincere woman. She is very optimistic too. She hopes that her initiative will be lucrative and will raise family funds with which she will be able to meet all the financial needs of her family and give her son higher education. Her thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase drinking water for distribution in the locality.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis septembre 2013.Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier, elles ont comme activité le commerce.

La représentante du groupe est celle qui se trouve en position debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main,elle est âgée de 41 ans et mére de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons le plus petit des enfants a 09 ans et le plus âgé a 20 ans.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des légumes pour une valeur de 50000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in September 2013. It comprises 25 women from the same district. Their work is in commerce. 

The group's representative is the one standing at the far right in the photo with her hand raised. She is 41 years old and a mother with six children, including four boys. The youngest child is 9 years old, and the oldest is 20.

She does commerce in vegetables. With her loan, she intends to purchase some vegetables worth 50,000 francs. Her goal is to augment her savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 39-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  His main business is a retail shop but he also owns rental houses and carries out agriculture in order to earn additional income.  He faces hardships of price fluctuations and limited capital to expand his business.  However, his vision is to own a wholesale shop.
 
Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy more commodities to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Eida Marta

texts.es: Eida, se ha dedicado por más de 28 años a trabajar en el campo de la confección de manera independiente; inició en esta actividad realizando arreglos de modistería pero, luego del fallecimiento de su esposo, se dedicó completamente a esta labor, pues requería generar recursos económicos para dar el sustento a sus 4 hijos y para solventar las necesidades del hogar, ya que toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella. Actualmente confecciona su línea propia de blusas, pantalones y artículos de decoración para el hogar, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida por su amplia trayectoria, experiencia y por la buena calidad de sus productos, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su tenacidad, pujanza y perseverancia le han permitido sobrepasar todos los obstáculos que la vida le presenta, haciéndola cada vez más fuerte y llenándola de energía positiva para seguir luchando. Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo de su quinto ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, encajes, botones, entre otros), de esta manera podrá tener disponible más variedad de inventarios para ofrecer y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela; lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos para continuar solventando los gastos familiares. Es así como Eida desea seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo que es fortalecer su negocio, hacerlo crece r y poder brindar mejores oportunidades de vida a sus hijos para que sean hombres de bien y con un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Eida has been working as an independent dressmaker for the past 28 years. She started this business doing some sewing but after her husband died she dedicated herself completely to this work. She had to generate resources to support her 4 children and pay for the household necessities. as the total financial responsibility fell on her.

Today she makes her own line of blouses, pants and articles for the home. She has the advantage of being recognized for her development, experience and the good quality of her product. This allows her to get ahead with her children. Her tenacity, vigor and perseverance have helped her overcome all obstacles that life has presented her, making her stronger each time and full of positive energy to continue struggling.

This is what motivated her to request her fifth loan which she will use to buy supplies wholesale (cloth, thread, lace, buttons, etc.). In this way she can have at hand a greater variety of inventory to offer and satisfy the tastes of her clients. This will allow her to generate more income to continue paying the family's expenses. So Eida can continue advancing toward her main goal which is to fortify her business, make it grow and be able to offer her children better opportunities in life so they can be good people and have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (cloth, thread, lace, buttons etc.).

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a self-motivated person. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years and her primary customers are local customers.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be disease outbreaks which affect milk production. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase animal feed. Her business goal is to have more dairy cows within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable.

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 44-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 10 to 20 years. He describes himself as a confident person. He operates a retail store where he sells hides and skins. He has been involved in this business for 4 years.

His business is located in a town centre and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge as transportation problems. He will use the 70,000 KES loan to add stock of hides and skins. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. 
He hopes that he will have a brighter future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of hides and skins

loans.name: Gyanibala

texts.en:
Gyanibala is a 46-year-old married woman with two children. Her children are receiving education. Her son is in class XII (Grade 12) and the daughter is in class VI (Grade 6). She and her husband have a small plantation where they grow different vegetables in different seasons and those vegetables are sold in the local market. She needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family, so she has applied for a loan to Belghoria Janakalyan Samity to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

Gyanibala will use the profits from sales to improve her business, support her family, and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a 28-year-old housewife. Her husband, Latiful, age 30, is a greengrocer. They live with two children in their own kaccha (mud- and straw-made) house in a small village Domhoni, in Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri district. Both Farida and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They give education to their two children with great difficulty. One of the children is in class I (Grade 1) and the second one is in preschool. It is very difficult for them to meet their household expenses and her children's educational expenses. Farida learned about Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) and applied for a loan to buy a larger variety of vegetables for selling in the market. She is very hopeful that if she purchases a larger variety of vegetables to sell, it will be very profitable, as there is a great demand for vegetables in the local market. She is motivated to give her full effort to expand the business. In the future, Farida wants to give higher education to the children by making good profit from the business. She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of vegetables for selling in the market.

loans.name: Rafael José

texts.es: Rafael es un campesino que durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas agropecuarias que aprendió de su padre desde que era muy pequeño, gracias a ello, hoy en día trabaja como mayordomo en una finca de la región donde reside y allí, su patrón le permite tener unas cabezas de ganado lechero cuya producción es vendida ya sea de manera líquida o transformada en queso, actividad que realiza de manera paralela a su empleo para complementar los ingresos con los que puede sustentar las necesidades básicas de su familia, conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos. El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre pujante, dedicado y muy buen trabajador, razón que lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar unas recipientes grandes de aluminio para almacenar el líquido blanco y unas cajas o neveras de icopor que le faciliten transportar los quesos para que éstos no pierdan la cadena de frío, pues de esto depende la calidad del producto final que se le entrega al consumidor; de esta forma tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar cada día las ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Todo esto le abre las puertas a Rafael para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, especialmente el de montar una microempresa productora de quesos, con la que podrá generar mayores ingresos que le darán estabilidad económica para seguir apoyando a su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is a farmer who has spent his entire productive life in agriculture.  He learned from his father from the time he was very small.  Today, thanks to his father, Rafael is the administrator of a farm in the region where he lives.  His boss allows him to have a few head of milk cows whose milk he sells as-is or made into cheese.  He does this in parallel with his job to supplement his income so he can cover the basic necessities of his family, which also includes his wife and three children.  

Rafael is known to be a vigorous, dedicated man and a good worker.  He's seeking a loan because he wants to buy some large aluminum containers to hold milk, and some coolers to facilitate transport of cheese so it stays cool because the quality of the final product he delivers to the consumer depends on it.  This will Rafael to improve his sales and income every day and will open doors for him to keep moving toward realizing his objectives, especially his goal of opening a small cheese-making business.  He'll be able to bring in more income which will give him the economic stability to keep supporting his family and giving them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy large aluminum containers to hold milk, and some coolers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 5 years. She describes herself as a confident person. She operates a retail store where she sells timber. 

She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a town centre and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be small business space. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to add to her stock of timber for resale.

Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a brighter future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to stock of timber for resale

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana de 25 años de edad,  estudio  hasta tercer año de primaria, hoy por hoy esta casada, su esposo  es agricultor; han procreado  tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno estudia,  en su casa vive el suegro quien esta padeciendo de una enfermedad de los riñones;  por lo que están invirtiendo buena parte de los ingresos en la enfermedad de él.


Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de ropa en los caseríos cercanos; lo hace a pie caminando por lo menos unos tres kilómetros dos veces por semana, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace dos años, así ayuda a los ingresos de él esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar con unos doscientos dólares en ropa para vender y le comprara unas medicinas al suegro que no ha podido comprar por falta de recursos; pero que existe la probabilidad de una mejora en la calidad de vida del suegro quien considera ha sido una persona que cuando pudo les apoyo mucho.
El sueño de Ana es que su suegro se alivie, luego mejorar el negocio para tener mejores ingresos pensando en que sus hijos estudien y por ultimo sueña con tener una casa digna para vivir.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, went to school up to the third grade.  Her husband is a farmer and they have three children of which only one is in school.  Her father-in-law, who suffers from kidney disease, lives in the house with them so they devote a good part of their income to his illness.  

Ana earns her living doing housework and in the afternoon she sells clothing in the little settlements nearby.  She walks at least three kilometers twice a week.  She's been in business for two years, adding to her husband's income.

The loan Ana is seeking will be used to buy around $200 in clothing for her to sell, and she'll purchase her father-in-law some medicine, which he hasn't been able to afford.  However, the likelihood exists that quality of life will improve for her father-in-law, who Ana sees as a person who has supported them a great deal when he was able to.  

Ana's dream is that her father-in-law will get better.  Then she wants to improve her business so she can make more income, and she wants her her children to go to school.  Finally, she want to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy around $200 worth of clothing to sell, and some medicines for her father-in-law who hasn't been able to buy them because he lacks the money.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 34-year-old single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as a go-getter and a manager. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more beauty products to use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide adequate income for her family. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more beauty products.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Millie

texts.en:
Millie is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as an industrious person. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. 

She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high operation costs.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase tailoring materials: i.e threads, fabric etc. Her business goal is to add more tailoring machines within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will live a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials: i.e threads and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 23-year-old married man. He describes himself as a hopeful person. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are small scale. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to boost business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to his stock of clothes for resale. His business goal is to have a financially stable business within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family life. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to start a new business.

loans.use: to add to his stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 23-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 5. She describes herself as a confident person. She operates a grocery stall where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a town centre and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent place for doing business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of fruits and vegetables.

Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a brighter future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build a house.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as a confident person. She operates a retail shop where she sells beauty products.

She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a town centre and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high initial capital. 

She will use the 60,000 KES loan to add to her stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that she will have a brighter future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build a house.

loans.use: to add to her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 5. She describes herself as a confident person. She operates a retail shop where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of constant customers. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of beauty products for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years.
She hopes that she will have a brighter future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of beauty products for resale

loans.name: Elvia Yolanda

texts.es:
Elvia es una señora casada de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una señora que se esmera por sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica en el lugar de su domicilio. Ella eligió esta actividad porque su madre le enseño cuando era pequeña. Ahora cuenta con 18 años de realizar esta labor que ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
Por la época del año ella ha observado que la demanda de la ropa típica incrementa ya que las personas de su comunidad, asisten a actividades para fin de año. Por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de hilos y jaspeado (hilo teñido) que servirá para la elaboración de la ropa típica.
Su mayor sueño es incrementar sus ganancias a través de su negocio, con el propósito de mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvia is a 25-year-old married woman.  She lives with her husband and son in the department of Sololá.  She dreams of getting her family ahead.  Currently she earns her living making traditional clothing in her house.  She chose this business because her mother taught it to her when she was young.  She's been doing it for 18 years now, and it has been quite productive in generating income and profits.  

This season she has noticed an increase in demand for traditional clothing because people in her community are attending end-of-year activities, so Elvia is seeking a loan for 8000GTQ to buy thread and woven fabrics that she'll use to make the clothing.  

Elvia's greatest dream is to use the business to increase profits so she can improve her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy thread and woven fabric to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a motivated person. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add to her stock of vegetables for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start a new business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es: Emanuel, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Emanuel se dedico por varios años a la agricultura y hace 6 años presta el servicio de barbería en la comunidad, realiza corte de cabello y barba. Este negocio lo tiene en un local de su casa. ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar productos que usa en la barbería como cremas de afeitar, talcos, Gillette, tijeras, rasuradoras, y también espejos. Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio para obtener mas ingresos y poderles dar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emanuel is 29 years old, married, has two sons and lives in the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Barbara.  Emanuel worked for several years in agriculture and six years go he started providing services as a barber in the community, cutting hair and beard.
He has this business located in his house, he has decided to request a loan for 20,000 HNL to buy products used in the barber shop such as shaving cream, powder, Gillette razors, scissors and mirrors.  His goal is to improve the business and obtain more income to be able to provide education for his children.

loans.use: to buy products used in the barber shop such as shaving cream, powder, Gillette razors, scissors and mirrors.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Liderando las Palmeras”  y se dedica a brindar servicio de movilidad escolar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este servicio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. Agradece por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: This is a member of the “Liderando las Palmeras” (Leading the Palms) Communal Bank, and she engages in providing school transportation services. She has been engages in this activity for many years and things are going very well. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to pay for the maintenance of her vehicle. She is grateful fort the loan and she commits to responsibly complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Nancy Estamilda

texts.es:
Nancy Estamilda agradece a los inversionistas por el prestamo y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermoza relacion tiene 2 hijos, ella continua con el negocio de snack y cafetería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9.00 p.m de lunes a vienres, ella por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad requiere el prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia como por ejemplo galletas, gasesosa, pasteles, golosinas y otras cosas mas. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy Estamilda is grateful to the lenders for the loan, and she is happy about the support that was provided.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children from this beautiful relationship.  She continues with her snack business and cafeteria.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. Mondays through Fridays.  She gets her children ahead through this business.

This time she needs the loan to buy more merchandise like cookies, soft drinks, cakes, candies, and other things.

She belongs to the “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like cookies, soft drinks, cakes, candies, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 4 hijos, ella continua con el negocio de venta de productos de maíz y de chuño, ella compra sus productos de la ciudad de Puno, Calca, Pisaq y Urubamba para luego lo venderlos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra maíz y  chuño. 

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS” y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The borrower is 52 years old and married.  She has four children as the fruit of her beautiful relationship.  She continues with the business of selling corn products and ‘chuño’ [a freeze dried potato product].  She buys her products in the cities of Puno, Calca, Pisaq, and Urubamba.  She then sells them at the different markets in the city of Cusco.

This time she needs the loan to buy corn and chuño.

She belongs to the “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS” communal bank.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy corn and chuño.

loans.name: Bibosi Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento BIBOSI, está compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un  varón,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Dora tiene 26 años casada con dos  hijos de las edades de 9 y 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Dora,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa según la temporada al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Dora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por ella y por sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso sacan solas adelante a su familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank BIBOSI is made up of 8 members:  7 women and 1 man. All of them have different lines of work. Dora is the president of the bank. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are 3 and 9 years of age.	

Dora earns a living by selling seasonal clothing. She sells her products in different fairs and expos in the city of Santa Cruz. This will be her first loan as part of the group, and she will use it to purchase seasonal clothing wholesale and thus keep her business well stocked. Dora is requesting this loan in order to increase her merchandise. Dora faces various challenges in her business, such as competition, and she will use the benefits of the loan to continue purchasing merchandise and earn more income.

Dora is grateful for this opportunity, both for herself and the fellow group members, as many of them are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Elsa Renee

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir delante, sobre todo porque es madre de familia y saca adelante a su hijo de 16años de edad; Elsa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de periódicos y revistas, asimismo también vende pan y algunos artículos de primera necesidad como leche en tarro, frutas, abarrotes, entre otros y de esta manera tener mas ingresos para su hogar.

Elsa esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, ya que podrá comparar libros y revistas al por mayor para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, así seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Elsa is a very hardworking woman who wishes to succeed, most of all since she is a mother and provides for her 16 year old son. She has a small business selling newspapers and magazines. She also sells bread, and some items of convenience, such as canned milk, fruit, and groceries, among others. This allows her to increase the income for her household. 

Elsa is very grateful to Kiva investors, as thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more goods for her business. She will be able to buy books and magazines wholesale to offer to her clients. This will allow her to continue working towards achieving her main goal: providing her son with an education so that he can work as a professional.

loans.use: to buy goods such as newspapers, magazines,  groceries.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
La señora Simona de 52 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, se preocupa por mantener su hogar muy limpio y preparar la alimentación a su esposo y sus hijos. Su nivel académico de 4º grado, ya que en la época en la cual ella se encontraba estudiando existía una difícil situación económica, la cual obligaba en su mayoría a los jóvenes a dejar sus estudios y dedicarse a realizar actividades para beneficio de su hogar.

La señora Simona se empeña, por darles lo mejor a sus hijos menores, ya que son dos los que se encuentran estudiando en el centro escolar de la comunidad, y los otros dos hijos están trabajando en Estados Unidos, desde hace 4 años; su esposo se dedica a las actividades agrícolas.

Tiene una experiencia de 37 años, realizando oficios domésticos, actividad que aprendió de su madre con quien se creció, en la actualidad su principal fuente de ingresos es de remesas de parte de sus dos hijos que se encuentran en Estados Unidos. 


El dinero otorgado en calidad de préstamo sera utilizado, para mejoramiento en la vivienda; ya que cuenta con dos habitaciones a los cuales va repellar y afinar las paredes, de esta manera su casa tendrá una mejor apariencia y estará garantizando el derecho a una vivienda digna a su familia. 


Las metas que la señora Simona, tiene para un futuro son, ayudar a sus hijos hasta que culminen sus estudios universitarios cuidar y dar lo mejor de si a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Señora Simona is a 52 year old housekeeper who works hard to maintain a very clean home and prepare meals for her husband and their children.  She has a 4th grade education because the economic situation was difficult when she was studying.  Most of the young people had to leave their studies and pursue activities for the benefit of their homes.  

Señora Simona endeavors to give the best to her youngest sons because the two of them are studying in the community school.  For the past four years her other two children have been working in the United States.  Her husband works in agriculture.  She has 37 years of experience as a housekeeper, a craft she learned from her mother who raised her.  Currently her main source of income is money sent from the United States by her other two sons.

The money granted as a loan will be used to improve their home.  It has two rooms whose walls she will re-plaster so her home will have a better appearance.  This will secure the right to a decent home for her family.  Señora Simona's goals for the future are helping their children until they complete their university studies and to look after and provide the best for their grandchildren.

loans.use: to improve her housing; it has two rooms whose walls she will replaster so her home will have a better appearance which will secure the right to a decent home for her family.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Земля в том месте, где живет Александр имеет свою особенность. Томаты плохо растут в этих краях, зато огурцы выходят превосходные. Александр вспоминает, как еще  с детства трудился  на огороде вместе с родителями, они привили ему любовь к земле. Три года назад их не стало, дом остался в наследство Александру, на работе он попал под сокращение и поэтому  у него появилось больше времени для развития своего бизнеса. По совету сестры обратился  за кредитом.  25,000 гривен поможет Александру построить дополнительную теплицу, а именно закупить недостающий материал – пленку, бруски, систему полива.
texts.en: Soil in the area where Alexander lives is very particular. Tomatoes don't grow well there, although excellent cucumbers can be produced. Alexander remembers working in the garden with his parents as a child, and how they taught him love of the earth. They passed away three years ago and the house was left to Alexander. His hours were shortened at work, so he suddenly had more time to develop his own business. He followed his sister's advice and applied for a loan. 25,000 hryvnia will help Alexander build an additional greenhouse, and pay for needed materials - sheeting, planks, and irrigation materials.

loans.use: to build an additional green house

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven soltero de 22 años de edad, quien vive junto a sus padres en el Departamento de Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura, eligió está labor ya que es una actividad productiva en donde obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia. Como también comenta que realiza esta actividad porque es una fuente de trabajo y no tiene  necesidad de viajar a otro departamento.
Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y abono orgánico para su cultivo.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su cultivo para obtener mejores ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is a single 22 year old man who lives with his parents in the county of Sololá.  He works in agriculture, a career which he chose because it is a productive job that allows him to earn a good income which allows him to contribute to his family's finances.  He also works in this industry because it provides a steady stream of jobs without having to travel to another county.  

He is seeking a loan of 3,500.00  Guatemalan Quetzals to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops.  His dream is to improve his crops in order to generate greater revenues and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Rumilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Rumilda es mujer de 41 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio, venta de granos básicos, vive con su familia que esta formada por su esposo y sus 3 hijos; los cuales se encuentran estudiando su educación básica en la escuela. La señora Rumilda se preocupa por darles lo necesario a sus hijos, ya que manifiesta que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y esta dispuesta a trabajar con todas sus fuerzas por verlos sueños de sus hijos cumplidos.  

Ella se de dedica al negocio de la venta de granos básicos, frijoles, café maíz. Ella tiene una experiencia de 10 años en el negocio, que aprendió de una tía, a la cual ella le ayudaba a vender en un puesto en el mercado desde hace 5 años; decidió poner su propia venta de granos básicos gestiono un puesto en el mercado y satisfactoriamente se le fue dado. Ella realiza el trabajo con ayuda de sus hijos cuando no tienen que estar en la escuela.  

El dinero sera utilizado, en la compra de granos para surtir y ampliar su puesto en el mercado y de esta manera dará un mejor servicio y gracias a ello mejorara sus ganancias económicas.

La meta mas grande que ella tiene, según manifiesta es la de apoyar a sus hijos hasta que ellos culminen sus estudios universitarios y con las ganancias del negocio ira ampliándose hasta tener un negocio de granos básicos mas surtido y formal.
texts.en:
Señora Rumilda is a 41 year old woman who works commercially selling basic commodities.  She lives with her family which includes her husband and three children who are completing their basic education studies in school.  Señora Rumilda is concerned to provide the necessities for her children because she did not have the opportunity to study.  She is willing to work with all of her strength to see her children's dreams fulfilled.  

She is engaged in the business of selling commodities, beans, coffee and corn. She has 10 years of experience in this business which she learned from an aunt who she helped for 5 years to sell goods in a stall at the market.  She decided to set up her own stall of commodities, and negotiated for a stall in the market which was satisfactorily provided.  She manages the work with help from their children when they do not have to be in school.

The money will be used to purchase commodities to supply and enlarge her booth in the market.  In this way she will offer better service and as a result improve her earnings.  Her overall goal is to support their children until they complete their university studies.  With the earnings she will expand until she has the largest assortment and most dependable business in the market.

loans.use: to purchase commodities to supply and enlarge her booth in the market.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
В центре с.В.Знаменка расположен магазин автозапчастей  Галины. Бизнес она ведет вместе с мужем, уже много лет.  Галина и ее муж очень открытые, общительные люди. Их хорошо знают  и уважают в районе, так как они сотрудничают с руководителями других сел, поставляют им запчасти на сельхозтехнику. За  время  работы приобрели большой опыт, поэтому знают какой товар завезти, чтобы покупатели могли приобрести у них все , что им нужно.
В последнее время Галина стала замечать, что запчасти на с/х технику стали покупать меньше, а на легковые авто спрос возрос. Поэтому чтобы не терять клиентов решили увеличить количество запчастей на легковые авто, для этого нужен кредит 21,000 гривен. Поученный кредит существенно поможет Галине в развитии ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Galina has a autoparts store in downtown V. Znamenka. She and her husband have been running the business together for many years. They are very open, sociable people. They are respected and well know throughout the region, since they provide agricultural equipment parts to drivers from other towns. With their extensive experience, they know what part to send, so that the buyers will have everything they need. Recently Galina noticed that fewer agricultural parts were being bought, and car parts were in higher demand. In order to not lose customers, they decided to expand their inventory of car parts, using a loan of 21,000 hryvnia. The loan will really help Galina develop her business.

loans.use: to increase inventory of spare parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación y tiene 2 hijos, ella continua con el negocio de venta de cosméticos en forma independiente. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cosméticos al por mayor como lápiz labiales, perfumes y esmaltes para uñas. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS” y agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Esther, 40, is married and has two children with her husband. She continues to be an independent cosmetics salesperson. She has applied for a loan to buy wholesale cosmetics like lipstick, perfume, and nail polish. She belongs to Liderando Las Palmeras communal bank and thanks those who share her dream through this group. She promises to make her payments on time.
