Oumar has been raising livestock for over 10 years. He specializes in cattle and spends most of his time with his animals, taking care of them by himself. Oumar is busy all day: the morning, he takes his animals out to the pasture, and in the evening, they return to their stalls in order to be taken care of as needed for their healthy growth. 

Simply to increase his headcount and manage the fodder cots, Oumar needs a loan of 500, 000 West African francs from a [microfinance] institution such as IMCEC. It should be noted that this business allows him to save a bit of money and provide for his family, improving their nutrition. Oumar would like to diversify his business. His dream is to open a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Para generar los ingresos con los que sustenta las necesidades de su hogar, ella trabaja en el campo de la confección a terceros desde hace aproximadamente 18 años y esto se ha convertido en su única fuente de empleo e ingresos; cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada directa y de su hijo a quien le fue enseñando poco a poco para que pueda tener una fuente de ingresos permanente que le permita ser independiente. Lucila con su perseverancia y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y, a pesar de las dificultades que se le presentan ella siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida, especialmente a la hora de contratar a una operaria que sea responsable y organizada que hoy en día es complicado. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar mejoras locativas y para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá optimizar mejor el espacio y mejorará las condiciones de trabajo, además tendrá los materiales necesarios para poder cumplir con la producción y así realizar las entregas de manera oportuna, lo que le dará la posibilidad de adquirir nuevos contratos para generar mejores ingresos.  Así es como Lucila ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y pretende que continúe generando ingresos para garantizar una estabilidad económica para disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su hijo.
texts.en:
Lucila is mother of one child and the head of her house since she and her husband separated. She has worked in the dressmaking business for approximately 18 years and this is her only job and income source to cover household expenses. She counts on a direct employee and also has the help of her son, whom she has been teaching the business little by little for him to have a permanent income source to become independent. Thanks to her determination and hard work, Lucila has been able to get ahead. She always has a positive attitude towards life despite all the difficulties that she encounters, especially when it comes to hire a worker who is responsible and organized, which is very complicated. 

She is currently requesting a loan to make improvements in her workshop and to buy supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, etc.). This will allow her to use the space more efficiently and to improve her working conditions, as well as to have the necessary materials to meet the demand and obtain new contracts to improve her income. This is how Lucila has been able to grow her business and how she plans to continue to generate income and guarantee a financial stability to enjoy a better quality of life with her son.

loans.use: to make improvements in her workshop and to buy supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, etc.).

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастуре 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Трое из детей женаты и проживают отдельно, младший сын проживает с родителями, он занимается реализацией каменного угля. У Мастуры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мастура занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мастуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 12 овец. Имеются все условия для содержания скота. Также имеет небольшую земельную долю, на которой выращивает многолетнюю траву. В один сезон урожайность травы составляет 600 тюков. Для собственного пользования используют 300 тюков сена, остальное на реализацию. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мастура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы и теленка в целях откорма и раелизации. Доходы от кредита Мастура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального обеспечения семьи.
texts.en: Mastura is 50 and married with four children. Three of them are married and live on their own, and her youngest son lives with his parents and works selling coal. Mastura has a high school education and raises animals and crops as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has four milk cows and 12 sheep that are well taken care of as well as a small parcel of land on which she grows hay, enough to harvest 600 bales in a season. She uses 300 of these bales for her own animals and sells the rest. Mastura's husband also helps a great deal with the business, monthly income from which is 5,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Mastura has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase a cow and a calf for fattening and resale. She plans to use profits from the loan for further augmentation of her herd, and for improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ngani

texts.en:
Ngani is a married woman with two children, both of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell food supplements business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling bananas. 

Marilou is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more products of food supplements to sell to her customers.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is taking a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as gasoline. She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of USD 500. 

Madalena is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is the age of 45, living in Lahore, with her husband and six children. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has grown old and his instruments have, as well. Worn-out instruments are in need of replacement with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments. 

Due to his low purchasing power, Rehana requested a loan, so that her husband can become empowered and he can easily buy new instruments, such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror, and a revolving chair.

Rehana hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some savings for household expenses. Rehana gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy instruments for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth es soltera, de profesión enfermera tiene un dependiente económico que es su hijo, con el que vive en la casa de su padre. Trabaja en una comunidad rural en una posta sanitaria de la provincia de Tiraque. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la cancelación de una deuda a terceros, este préstamo lo saco su hermano con objeto de comprar un vehículo para hacer trabajar en una línea de sindicato de transporte, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, con muchas ganas de superare, si recurre a un crédito es porque el sueldo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and works as a nurse. She has a son whom is dependent on her and she lives with him in the house of her father. She works at a Health center in a rural community in the province of Tiraque.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to pay off a debt to a third party. Her brother took out a loan to buy a vehicle to work in a transportation union. Elizabeth is a very hard-working person with much desire to get ahead. She is resorting to a loan as her wages do not allow her to cover all her expenses.

loans.use: to pay off a loan to a third party.

loans.name: Laxmirani

texts.en:
Laxmirani is a rural housewife from the village of West Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in their own kachha house (bamboo, mud and straw-made). Her husband, Ranjit, is 38 years old. Laxmi and her husband both completed primary education. Their only daughter is married and their two sons are unemployed.

Laxmirani’s husband is an experienced farmer. To take care of the needs of his family, he grows different vegetables in different seasons. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of income for the family.

As the costs of essential commodities are increasing day by day, Laxmirani needs to expand their agribusiness to be able to more effectively meet the family's needs. So, she asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and good quality fertilizers for potato cultivation on their agricultural land. As it is a profitable business, she hopes that it will help her family sustain their agribusiness and help them to earn more profits.

Laxmirani dreams to give financial assistance to her family, give a better life to their children and enhance her business to secure their future life.

Laxmirani and her husband are thankful to the lenders, BJS and a Kiva, for their support.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Gissela Lizbeth

texts.es:
Gissela es una joven de 24 años de edad, vive en el distrito de San juan de Lurigancho y se dedica a la venta de aretes artesanales y ropa, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios ya que actualmente estudia la carrera de Administración hotelera.

Gissela esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas materiales e insumos parta la confección de sus aretes, como hilos, pedrerías, entre otros; de esta manera podrá elaborar más variedad de aretes y también podrá comprar mas ropa para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir la casa de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Gissela is a young woman of 24. She lives in the San Juan de Lurigancho district and sells handmade earrings and clothing. She works about 9 hours every day and with the fruit of her labor she can pay for her studies. She is enrolled in Hotel Administration.

Gissela is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the help they have offered she can buy the materials and supplies, like thread and stones etc. that she needs to to make her earrings. Then she can make a greater variety of earrings. She also wants to buy more clothes to offer her customers. She wants to continue struggling to achieve her big dream, which is to finish the construction of her parent's house.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies needed to make handcrafted earrings.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 25-year-old woman, married and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). She is a housewife and lives with her husband and children in the small town of West Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband, Nirmol, both have an education up to grade 5. One of their children goes to school and reads in grade 1, the other is below school-going age.

Laxmi's husband is an experienced farmer. He is the main breadwinner of the family. This is a very important source of income for them. Laxmi helps him in his work and sell the products in the local market. However, his income is too low, so he cannot afford a living based on that alone.

Laxmi wants to extend her helping hands to her husband. She decided to start potato cultivation on their land, and for that she requested a loan from BJS. She will buy potato seeds and fertilizers with the loan. This product has good potential in the local market and thus, she hopes to earn much profit from it.

She hopes to give good financial support to her family, give better education to her children and purchase a plot of land in the future with the profit generated from the business.

She and her husband are thankful to all the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for helping them to maintain their business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años vende en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus frutas y verduras, vive en casa propia con su hija. Francisca solicita un préstamo para poder comprar plátanos, naranjas, papas, guineos, y todo lo que necesita para acrecentar su negocio y así tener sus clientes satisfechos cuando la busquen para comprarle sus productos y ella podrá tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Francisca has been a seller of fruits and vegetables for several years. She sells at the market near her place of residence. She has many clients and she sells her fruits and vegetables at a good price. She lives at her own house with her daughter.

Francisca is asking for a loan so that she can buy bananas, oranges, potatoes, guineos (baby bananas), and everything that she needs to improve her business. This will allow her to give satisfaction to her customers when they come to her to buy her products and she will be able to have higher profits which will help her to give her kids a better life.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, potatoes, guineos (baby bananas), papayas, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Caty Celina

texts.es: Caty de 28 años de edad habita en casa familiar junto a sus padres y se dedica a la preparación y venta de deliciosos pasteles los cuales vende en su hogar de habitación y gracias a la calidad y buenos preciso muchas personas la prefieren cada día más. Ella desea ampliar su negocio por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (azúcar, harina, huevos, fruta, jaleas, etc.) para la elaboración de los ricos pasteles y de esta forma contribuir a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Caty, 28, lives together with her parents. She makes and sells delicious cakes at home. Thanks to the good quality her products have, her customer base is growing every day more. She wants to expand her business, so she decided to request a loan at FUSAI. She will buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her delicious cakes (sugar, flour, eggs, fruits, jam, etc.) and in this way contribute to the improvement of her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, eggs, fruits, jam, etc. to prepare cakes.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 29 years old and single.

Emelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her general store.

Emelita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and raising livestock.

Emelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and married. She has eight children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, hair conditioners, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan.

Teresita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, hair conditioners, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market that is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of seasonal fruits like apples, bananas and oranges in his shop.

Currently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

He will purchase a variety of fresh fruits for winter season. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruits from the field to sell.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 36 years old, married, and the mother of a daughter. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. 

For this reason, Zakia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to maintain the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 46 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of  six children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

This will help him to continue generating income to sustain his family life. Nasreen is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with eight children, two of whom attend school; the rest have completed school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Umazi has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Umazi wants to purchase sweets, ground nuts, biscuits, bread, milk, and bananas for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, ground nuts, biscuits, bread, milk, and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Pascuela

texts.en:
Pascuela is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as oils, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and fish. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Pascuela is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and fish.

loans.name: Jean Karlo

texts.es:
Jean tiene 20 años y trabaja como empleado de seguridad desde hace 2 años, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su empleo puede salir adelante.
Jean agradece el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera el podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Jean, 20, has worked in security for two years.  He works around 10 hours a day and gets ahead with the fruit of his labor.

Jean's grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy construction supplies to make improvements on his home.  This way he'll be able to give his family a better quality of life and continue striving to achieve his big dream, to finish building his house of quality materials.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Sol Maria

texts.es: Desde hace 2 años, Sol decidió emprender su negocio, observando a sus familiares que ofrecían servicios de alquiler de lavadoras en su barrio y les resultaba muy productivo. Decidida tomó sus ahorros e invirtió en maquinas para lavar y fue ofreciendolas entre sus vecinos, poco a poco su negocio empezó a crecer y hoy cuenta con 10 maquinarias, cuyos servicios se extienden a zonas aledañas a su barrio. Desde los lunes hasta los domingos, Sol trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 8 de la noche sin cesar, pues su clientela está conformada por amas de casa y trabajadores que al llegar de su trabajo necesitan el servicio. Su fama se ha extendido y hoy requiere tener mas maquinarias para llegar a nuevos barrios, para ello ha recurrido a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 3 lavadoras mas, con ello proyecta incrementar su clientela y generar mas ingresos beneficiando a su familia.
texts.en:
Two years ago Sol decided to start her own business seeing that some family members rented washing machines in her neighborhood with very productive results. She decided to take her savings and invest in washing machines and offer this service to her neighbors. Little by little her business grew and today she has 10 machines and her services cover some of the areas beyond her neighborhood.

Sol works from 7 am until 8 pm from Monday through Sunday non stop. Her clients are housewives and workers who arrive from their work needing her services. Her fame has spread and she now needs more machines to reach other neighborhoods. So she is requesting a loan from Kiva, the first financing she has had through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy 3 more washing machines with which she hopes to increase her clientele and generate more revenue benefiting her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines.

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15, 8 y 2 años de edad, el posee un taller de enderezado y pintura en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y amabilidad, José está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, herramientas, etc.  para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, 41, lives in a relative's house with his wife and three children, ages 15, 8, and 2. For some years, he has had an auto paint and body shop in his house. His workmanship and friendliness have gained him many customers. José has applied for a loan to buy paint, varnish, tools, and more to keep working, as this is his only income source and it provides his family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, tools, etc.

loans.name: Sulaiti

texts.en:
Sulaiti is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the region of Iganga in Uganda. He is married and has three  children, with two of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Sulaiti has been working hard to manage his clothes business, which deals in clothing of different kinds. 

To help expand his business, Sulaiti has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for his business.  It will help Sulaiti to generate greater profits and expand the business, which will bring about more income to be used for education of his children. 

Sulaiti hopes that in the future he will be able to get a bigger shop. 

Sulaiti is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiti who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Lucy has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Karuwa

texts.en:
Karuwa is married woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks,  rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y madre en el distrito de Querocotillo, su población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral cuyes, gallinas, patos, ganado caprino, porcino, desde hace más de 05 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Olivia is 29 years old and lives with her son and her mother in the Querocotillo district, where it’s residents farm and raise mostly rice and also work as merchants and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Cutervo, part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She raises and sells corral animals such as Guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, goats, and pigs and has done so for five years.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced feed for her animals so she can increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Baroni

texts.en:
Baroni is a 47-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Sankar, who is 54 years old. Both of them are illiterate, but know to sign their names. Her husband is a farmer by profession. They have two daughters. They are studying in class VI (grade 6) and VII (grade 7) respectively. Her husband usually sells vegetables, which are grown on his own land, in the local village market, but they have a scanty income. That’s why they are leading a very hard life. 

With the loan, Baroni wishes to buy bean seeds for cultivating broad beans on their own land to generate more income. The reason for choosing this business is only due to having their own land and a sound experience in the agricultural field. Baroni is confident that she will be able to grow her business. 

As she is living in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw) in Dhupguri, she wants to build a concrete house with the profit she will earn from her business. She also dreams her children will lead a very successful life with a good education if she is able to keep all the profits. 

Baroni is a woman with great enthusiasm and never wants to stop fighting for her family. She thanks Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: to cultivate broad beans on her own land.

loans.name: Feroza

texts.en:
Feroza is a 22-year-old housewife from Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Md. Ajijul, who is 28 years old, and they have two children. Feroza and her husband both are illiterate and able to sign their names only. Amongst the children, one is in class II (grade 2) and the other one is too small to go to school. 

Feroza’s husband cultivates many kinds of vegetables on his own land and sells those vegetables in the market. Now Feroza has given preference to the cultivation of potatoes, as this is a very profitable job in her area. She wishes to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes and wants to give financial support to her husband.  

Now she has a kaccha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo), but in the future, she dreams to build a concrete house of her own with the profits from her potato business so that she can live happily with her family. 

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS because in her bad days, BJS and Kiva have come forward to help her, and she has seen the light of prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 23 years old and is a married woman with one child. She owns and operates a business venture designing clothes. She has two years of experience in this kind of business.

Janice needs a loan to buy rubber, stencils, paints, brushes, and materials. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to pay for rubber, stencils, paints, brushes and materials

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 16 años, una niña de 14 años y un niño de 9 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva tanto en su lugar de residencia como de forma ambulante. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de desarrollo.  Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir y desea heredar a sus hijos. Actualmente, el corredor necesita cambio de la cubierta del techo ya que se encuentra dañado y no da el soporte necesario. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines y pago de mano de obra para  dar inicio a la reparación de la cubierta del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en: María, 46, is the single mother of a 16-year-old daughter, a 14-year-old daughter, and a 9-year-old son. She sells new clothing from her home and as a street vendor. She works hard to support her family and give her children better conditions. Her house is her main asset. She put a lot of effort into building it and wants her children to inherit it. Now she needs to replace the hallway roof, which is damaged and doesn't provide the necessary support. She has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized steel and supports and to pay workmen to repair her roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel and supports and to pay workmen to repair her roof.

loans.name: Mirna Yesenia

texts.es: Mirna de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 14 meses. Mirna se dedica a la venta de tortilla desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma ha logrado contribuir con la economía del hogar ya que con los ingresos que percibe su compañero de vida no alcanzan a cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para una mayor comodidad y privacidad para su hijo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de adobes, lámina galvanizada, hierro y pago de mano de obra para comenzar a construir el cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: Mirna, 21, lives in her own house with her family, which comprises her life partner and their 14-month-old son. Mirna has been selling tortillas for a long time. She has been able to help pay household expenses this way, since her partner's income doesn't cover all their costs. She wants to build a bedroom so that their son is more comfortable and has privacy. She has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy adobe, laminated steel, and iron and to pay workmen to build a room as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy adobe, laminated steel, and iron and to pay workmen to build a room.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 40 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos de 20 años, 18 años, 11 años y 6 años de edad y habita junto a ellos y su compañero de vida. Teresa se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos desde hace 4 años. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su comunidad y gracias a los buenos productos que ofrece ya cuenta con variedad de clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en mayor inventario para su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de camarones, pescado y conchas para satisfacer a una mayor demanda de mercado y así lograr percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old and the mother of four children aged 20, 18, 11 and 6, and lives with them and her partner. Teresa has made a living buying and selling seafood for four years. She goes around her community offering her produce and thanks to the high-quality products she offers she already has various customers who favour her more each day.

She would like to invest in more stock for her business, which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying prawns, fish and shells to satisfy a greater market demand and thus achieve higher profits which allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy prawns, fish and shells.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Cela fait deux ans maintenant que monsieur Ibrahima s’active dans le commerce de cosmétiques. Il a ouvert une cantine et évolue aussi dans le cadre du transfert d’argent » Wari «. 
Ibrahima est mariée et père de famille, il s’occupe des charges familiales et de la scolarité de ses enfants. Et c’est grâce aux recettes de son activité qu’il réussi à s’acquitter de ces devoirs familiaux. Il réussi aussi à épargner un peu afin de faire face aux probables imprévus.
Ibrahima travaille de 8Heures à 19Heures et compte une clientèle pas négligeable grâce en partie au service de transfert d’argent qui marche bien et qui attire pas mal de clients.
Son vœu le plus cher sera d’améliorer les services de transfert d’argent et de les varier.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima has already been active for two years in the cosmetic products trade. He opened a stall and also works with Wari, the mobile money transfer service. Ibrahima is a married father with a family. He takes care of family expenses and his children's schooling costs. And thanks to the receipts from his business, he manages to meet his family obligations. He also manages to save a little money to cope with unforeseen situations.  

Ibrahima works from 8 AM to 7 PM, and he has a significant customer base, thanks in part to the money transfer service, which is doing well and attracting a good number of customers. His greatest wish is to improve and diversify his money transfer services.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to resell and to provide mobile money transfer services

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijas que viven con el en su casa hecha a base de material noble. Se inició desde muy joven trabajando en el campo cultivando varios de los productos mas rentables de su zona tales como son el cacao orgánico, café, barbasco y otros logrando con el tiempo cumplir sus objetivos como la construcción de su vivienda; entre otros. Con el paso de los años optó por dedicarse también a la compra de productos por recomendación de un familiar logrando de a pocos convertirlo en su principal oficio. Es una actividad a la que se dedica más de 10 años y le ha permitido obtener buenas ganancias en beneficio de su economía familiar. Trabajar con barbasco según comenta implica tener cierto cuidado puesto que son raíces que serán posteriormente usadas para insecticidas y repelentes naturales.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que es como un puente entre los agricultores que traen sus productos hasta un ambiente que habilitó en su vivienda para luego vendérselo a los grandes acopiadores de su región obteniendo por ello sus respectivas ganancias. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad  desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para usarlo como capital en la compra de barbasco en esta temporada de alta demanda.
texts.en:
Luciano, who is 35 years old, is married and has 3 daughters who live with him in his house which is made of good quality building materials. From a very young age he worked in farming, growing a variety of the most profitable products in the area such as organic cocoa, coffee, barbasco and other crops. Over time he was able to fulfil his objectives, one of which was to build his own house. After a few years he decided, on the recommendation of a family member, to make a living by buying produce and gradually this became his main business. He has been doing this for more than 10 years and this has enabled him to make good profits which have benefitted the household finances. 

Luciano says that working with barbasco requires a certain amount of care, since they are roots which will ultimately be used for insecticides and natural repellents. He really likes his work since he acts as a bridge between the growers who bring their produce to him, to an area he has set side at his home, and the big wholesale buyers in the region whom he sells to. This is how he makes his profits. 

This is Luciano's second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he is getting to make progress in life. He promises to pay his loan instalments punctually. On this occasion he hopes to have 2,000 nuevos soles to use as capital for buying barbasco during this period of high demand.

loans.use: to buy barbasco.

loans.name: Danas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento DANAS DEL SUR,  está compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Ruthy, tiene 34 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 7 años,  en la foto la señora Ruthy es la del bolsón café y blusa lila,   ella se dedica a vender en un mercado cerca de su casa vende por las mañanas empanadas y por las noches cena, su esposo también le ayuda en lo económico ya que el trabaja con su propia carpintería,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo de  para la compra de insumos al por mayor y asi incrementar su capital de trabajo, la señora Ruthy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el que enfrenta es la falta de capital para aumentar sus ventas ya que ella se encuentra en mercado que va creciendo. Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  ampliar la venta de comida  ya que le va muy bien ya que está incrementando su clientela.
texts.en:
The communal bank DANAS DEL SUR is made up of eight members: seven women and one man, who all work different jobs. 

The president of the bank is Ruthy, who is 34 and married with one seven year old son. In the photo Ruthy is the one with the brown satchel in the purple blouse. She sells empanadas (a kind of pastry) in the mornings at a market near her house, and sells dinner in the evenings. Her husband also helps with the finances by working in his own carpentry shop. 

This loan is Ruthy's first cycle within the institution. She is going to use the loan to buy supplies wholesale, and as such increase her working capital. Ruthy faces challenges in her business which include the lack of capital to increase her sales, since she sees the market is growing. She will use the funds to continue improving her business, and her wish for her business is to increase food sales since it is going well and her clientele is growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale.

loans.name: 18 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento 18 DE DICIEMBRE,  está compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Mirtha, tiene 56 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 18 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de Villa Dolores,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor como fideo, arroz y azúcar y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, la señora Mirtha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el que enfrenta es la falta de capital para aumentar sus ventas,  Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  ampliar la venta poniendo un almacén donde pueda vender variedad de productos de primera necesidad y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The 18 DE DICIEMBRE Entrepreneurial Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men, each with their own businesses.  

Mirtha serves as the group’s president.  She is 56 years old, has an 18 year old son, and sells groceries in her store, located in the Villa Dolores zone.  This will be her first loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy groceries such as noodles, rice, and sugar in quantity.

Mirtha has challenges in her business, such as lack of capital to increase her sales.  She will use the benefits to help improve her business.  She wants to expand her sales by opening a store when she can sell a variety of primary needs products and increase her income in this way.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.es: La señora Fransisca está casada pero no vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos dependientes a su cargo, se encuentra en la localidad de Esquilan y es de familia humilde, se dedica a la producción de leche cruda pero la misma es baja debido a que su ganado no está siendo muy bien alimentado por ello requiere un crédito de Bs. 10200 para comprar alimento balanceado y soya para su ganado con un grupo de personas que está haciendo la compra en conjunto.
texts.en: Fransisca is married, but she does not live with her husband and she does not have any dependent children. She lives in the village of Esquilan and comes from a humble family. She makes a living producing milk, but her production is currently low because her cattle are not very well fed. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of 10,200 bolivianos to buy balanced feed and soy for her cattle. She will buy these products along with a group of people who are organizing a group purchase.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and soy for her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero vive en la cuidad de Lima, Miguel Ángel es una persona muy empeñosa y creativa, su comida favorita es el ají de gallina.
Miguel Ángel, tiene su propio negocio de cabinas de internet, el cual ya viene atendiendo hace muchos años, el día a día les da la mejor atención a sus clientes, los cuales ya se han fidelizado con él porque es una persona muy alegre y amable.
Miguel Ángel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en comprar más computadoras y así ampliar su negocio, atender más clientes y así cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, 29, is single and lives in the city of Lima. Miguel Ángel is determined and creative. His favorite food is garlic chicken. He has has his own internet café for many years. Every day he provides his clients with excellent service. They are loyal because he is a happy, friendly man. 

Miguel Ángel thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow him to buy more computers to grow his business and serve more clients. This way he will be able to realize his dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, donde su población se dedica al comercio, al cultivo de frutales, ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Morropon, que se ubica en la ciudad de Piura.

Ella se dedica al comercio de granos, los distribuye a los caseríos aledaños en su vehículo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo, y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is 35 years old and lives in the district of Buenos Aires. The people in this area work in commerce, in the cultivation of fruit, and in raising livestock. She lives two hours from the city of Morropón, which is located in the Piura region.

Agustina sells grain in the villages in her area by vehicle. She has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles for the mainentance of her vehicle, which is a tool she needs for her work. This would enable her to continue earning money for her family.

loans.use: to maintain her car.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 29-year-old woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her husband is a turner by profession, he works over a lathe machine. He manufactures the spare parts of vehicles, electrical goods, etc. He has been doing this business for many years and, until this time, his business has been much settled. 

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some of the important parts of lathe machine have been tearing off and they are in urgent need of replacement. Without replacement of the affected parts, the whole mechanism of lathe machine is affected.

Nazia's husband is a poor person and he does not have sufficient money to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or to buy some cutting tools. Therefore, Nazia requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine. 

Nazia hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business, as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix her husband's lathe machine and to buy some cutting tools.

loans.name: Gardenia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Gardenia es una mujer de 45 años, casada con Hipólito de, tiene tres hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo tienen casa propia, su niña de 11 aún vive con ellos y se encuentra estudiando sus dos hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
Gardenia y su familia viven en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, conocida también porque en esta provincia habita la etnia Tsáchila que son nativos de la región perteneciente a Ecuador; en este lugar se reciben visitan de turistas nacionales e internacionales que quieren conocer un poco más de la cultura Tsáchila.  Su esposo Hipólito trabaja en el comercio de compra y venta de chatarra ya varios años, ha sido el sustento de su hogar, poco a poco pudieron sacar con esfuerzo adelante a sus hijos los cuales ya son independientes. 
Gardenia también quiso mejorar sus ingresos, por eso hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de revistas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, cuentan con clientela fija a quien visita todos los días, su sueño es contar con su propio local pero para eso necesita de capital de trabajo para crecer y obtener más ganancias, 
Ahora Gardenia solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en compra de más cosméticos que se encuentran en oferta por la temporada navideña estos ingresos le brindaran una mejor utilidad, agradece mucho a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva que han sido quienes les apoyan y ayudan a mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gardenia is 45 years old. She is married to Hipólito, and has three children. Thanks to their hard work they have their own home. Their 11-year-old daughter lives with them and goes to school, while their two sons are now grown up and independent.

The family lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a very commercial and productive city. It is also well-known because the people of the Tsáchila ethnic group live in this region of Ecuador, and so it receives visits from Ecuadorian and international tourists who want to learn more about the Tsáchila culture. Gardenia's husband Hipólito has worked for several years in the business of buying and selling scrap, and has been the household's main support. Little by little, with hard work they were able to help their children do well and become independent.

Gardenia too wanted to do something to improve their income, and so for the past three years she has worked selling cosmetics from catalogues. She is a very hard-working woman, and she has established customers who she visit every day. Her dream is to have her own shop, but for this she needs working capital to expand and improve her earnings.

Gardenia is now seeking a loan, which she will invest in buying more cosmetics, which are currently on special offer over the Christmas season. The income from selling these will be highly useful to her. She is very grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for supporting her family and helping them improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at seasonal prices.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
Doña María Gertrudis tiene 58 años de edad, casada, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 8 hijos de los cuales solo una hija vive con ella y su pareja ya que los demás están en hogares aparte. Su grado de educación es de primaria pero no pudo terminar ya que la economía en su hogar no era la mejor por lo que solo pudo cursar 3 años. Junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura ya que la experiencia que ambos tienen es mucha siendo la de ella de más de 24 años la cual adquirió los primeros conocimiento a muy temprana edad por sus padres y posteriormente siguió elaborando con su esposo especializándose en la siembra y cultivo de café. Sus cultivos de café mismos que fueron heredados por su padre están ubicados a 15 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando para dar asistencia y mantenimiento evitando de esa manera la contaminación y deterioro del producto.
Sus metas seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café, sembrar una nueva plantilla de mejor calidad como la caturra y fortalecer el patrimonio familiar ya que esa será la herencia para sus hijos. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en todas y cada una de sus decisiones que contengan buenos y prósperos resultados para ellos como personas y para sus hogares. Por lo que hoy día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como urea, foliares, formula cafetalera, insecticidas, fungicidas entre otros que ayudaran a mantener sanos y libre de plagas sus cultivos de café para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Doña María Gertrudis, 58, is married. She works both taking care of the household chores and in agriculture. She has eight children, but only one of them (a daughter) lives with her and her partner; the rest live with their families. She studied only three years of primary school and could not continue due to financial problems at home.

María and her husband work in agriculture. They both have a vast experience; 24 years in her case. She started learning from her parents when she was very young and then specialized in coffee plantations together with her husband. She inherited the coffee plantations from her father, and they are located fifteen minutes away from where they live. They have to walk in order to give them maintenance, clean them and avoid any damage on the product.

Her goals are to enlarge her coffee plantations, plant a new type of coffee with better characteristics, called "caturra", and strengthen the family’s assets, which will become their legacy to their children. As a mother, she wants to support their children and hopes that they are successful and prosperous, for their and their family’s sake.

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as urea, leaf fertilizers, specialized coffee nutrients, insecticides and fungicides. All this will help her to keep her plantations healthy and free from plague during this season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Victor Alan

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Ica y trabaja en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad como empleado de la zona de encomiendas, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo puede salir adelante, sobre todo porque e spadre de un pequeño de 1 año.

Victor gracias a la ayuda de los prestamitas kiva podrá comprar materiales de construcción con lo cual podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, sobre todo porque se acerca el periodo de lluvias y desea asegurar el techo de su vivienda y de etsa manera no se inunde; asi mejorara su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Ica and works at a transportation company in his city completing assignments. He works around nine hours a day and with this work, he is able to move forward. He also does this because he is the father of a one-year-old son.

Thanks to the help of Kiva loans, he will be able to buy construction materials so he can make home improvements. This is important because the rainy season is coming and he wants to secure his roof so the house doesn't flood. This will improve his quality of life and and help him keep working toward his dream, which is for his son to have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Denis Ruben

texts.es: Denis está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le han brindado los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá comprar una refrigeradora con lo cual podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y poder conservar de manera mas higiénica sus alimentos, así el podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Denis is very grateful for the support of Kiva lenders because their help will allow him to buy a refrigerator to improve his quality of life by preserving his food in a more hygienic manner. This will help him to keep working to fulfill his greatest dream, which is to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Golima

texts.en:
Golima, aged 45, along with her husband, Abdul, is raising her three children. Both Golima and her husband are illiterate, but know how to sign their names. As she is a housewife, she manages all household matters, and her husband is involved in agriculture. Unfortunately their income is not enough to raise three children. The children are also engaged in farming rather than going to school due to poverty.  

She now wishes to help her husband financially and to give her family a better life. She came to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for help and applied for loan. With this loan, she wants to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes. She would like to extend her business and needs more laborers to assist her in this work. 

In the future, with the profit she earns from her business, she wants to build a concrete house in Dhupguri so that her children can have a better lifestyle. Golima hopes with the loan money, she can manage to expand their business without any problems. 

She is very much thankful to Kiva and BJS for the loan. Golima has proved that it is not difficult to see the light of success by overcoming hurdles if financial assistance is received.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on her own land.

loans.name: Alejandro Gaspar

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 28 años de edad, el vive en la hermosa ciudad de Camana, junto a sus padres, Alejandro es una persona muy alegre y responsable, el trabaja haciendo colectivo a las diversas zonas de la cuidad de Camana, trabajo el cual le ha permitido conocer a muchas personas y por ende muy tener muchos clientes, los cuales se sienten en confianza, porque Alejandro maneja con mucha precaución. 
Alejandro es muy agradecido con los prestatarios KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en realizar mantenimiento a su auto, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo diario.
El sueño de Alejandro es tener su casa propia y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Alejandro, 28, lives with his parents in the beautiful city of Camaná.  He's a very happy and responsible person.

He works driving a shared taxi to different areas of the city, which has enabled him to meet a lot of people.  Consequently he has a lot of customers who trust him because he's a very careful driver.

Alejandro's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because he'll invest his money in maintenance on his car, which is his tool for his daily work.

Alejandro's dream is to have his own house and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his car

loans.name: Gourirani

texts.en:
Gourirani is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of two sons. She, her husband, Prabhat, and their children all belong to a small town, Baroghoria, of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. Gourirani and her husband both are illiterate, but can sign their names. She is a housewife and her husband has a poultry farm. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses. Their children are also deprived of getting education due to their poverty. They assist their father in the poultry farm. 

At present, the poultry farm business is not in a good condition, as they have no capital to expand the farm. Gourirani heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and that the organization helps rural women, and she applied for a loan. 

With the loan money, she will buy more chicks, feed and medicines for her poultry farm, so that she can earn more profit from this business. She is much interested to expand this business because after the growth of their chicks, they can sell them to the meat shop in the local market and can earn the profit easily. As her husband is more experienced in this field, it will help her to run the business smoothly. 

Now she is living in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but she hopes that she will be able to build a concrete house for her family with the profit from their business. In spite of being unable to provide their sons’ education, she is trying her best to achieve all her desires for her children. She thanks Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: to expand her existing  poultry farm business.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the region of Mbarara in Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. 

For the past 1 year, Wilfred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which deals in general retail items like sugar, soap, bread, posho (maize flour), Omo (a detergent), cooking oil and batteries. 

To help expand his business, Wilfred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock items like Omo, cooking oil, toilet paper, batteries, and will help Wilfred to generate greater profits and open up more shops. Wilfred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to educate his children. 

Wilfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like Omo, cooking oil, toilet paper, and batteries

loans.name: Jose Adilio

texts.es: José de 62 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales desde hace tres años. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad y cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. Desea construir un baño con pila dentro de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y lámina para poder dar inicio  a la construcción del baño lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José, 62, lives in his own house with his wife. He has been selling natural medicines in local neighborhoods for three years as a street vendor and has a lot of clients who each day prefer his service more.

He wants to build a bathroom with a sink inside his house. He has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, and galvanized sheets to build the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and galvanized sheets to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Ángela Benedicta

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí vive la señora Ángela, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha procreado tres hijas de 20, 19 y 10 años de edad, dos de ellas están en universidad y la menor en escuela. El esposo es estilista.

Doña Ángela se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces, todas las mañanas se levanta a las 5h00 a preparar los dulces, una vez preparado sus deliciosos dulces los entrega a comerciantes que se los llevan a vender a otros cantones y ciudades del país. Este crédito lo realiza para el negocio del esposo el cual tiene un salón de belleza, en el mismo realiza todo tipo de trabajos de belleza, el trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y ella le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo ya que también tiene su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar tintes, esmaltes, shampú, etc. necesarios en el salón de belleza. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un buen local donde preparar y vender los dulces y un carro.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte settlement.  This place is known all over the country for its delicious sweets prepared by the local people.

Angela lives here.  She is 38 years old, married and has three daughters, ages 20, 19, and 10.  Two of them study at university and the youngest attends school.  Her husband works as a stylist.  Angela makes and sells candies.  She gets up at 5:00 am every morning to prepare the candy and then delivers them to merchants who take them to other settlements and towns around the country.

She will use the money from this loan for her husband’s beauty salon.  He works every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and she helps him when she can, since she has her own business.  This loan will be used to buy tints, nail polish, shampoo, etc. needed for the salon.

She has been with the communal bank for six years and she likes the help she gets from the loans.  Her dreams are to have a good place from which to prepare her candy and a car.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 60 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Antonia has a sewing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 22 years. 

Antonia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional materials such as fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.  In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Activas está en el 1er ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una está dando su mayor esfuerzo por poder crecer y ayudar a su familia con los ingresos que tiene.
Una de las señoras es Ana, quien mostró en su encuesta un nivel uno, es decir con un nivel de ingresos bajos, pero ella está consciente que debe seguir trabajando para mejorar y ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de grasa de animales, y aunque es un trabajo muy humilde este orgullosa porque es el medio de ayudar a su familia.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de grasa de animales para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo y también seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Activas” and is in its first cycle of the Woman’s Committee, where each of the members is giving their best effort to grow and help their families with their incomes.  Ana is one of the members and she showed to be level one in her survey, referring to her low income, but she knows that she needs to continue working to improve and help her family.  She sells animal fat and even though the work is humble, she is proud because she is able to help her family.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy animal fat to sell, and be able to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy animal fat.

loans.name: Hiperbanco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HIPERBANCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Mary ella es casada, tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de kiosco escolar, la socia trabaja con su negocio en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia vende galletas,empanadas,fruta entre otros para los alumnos que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a elaborar loncheras (refrigerios) en los distintos colegios que solicita sus servicios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como  galletas, frutas entre otros.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “HIPERBANCO” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  Mary, a member, is 44 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business, which is a school kiosk.  She works in her business in one of the schools in the city of Cusco.  

She sells cookies, empanadas, and fruit, among other things to the students who request them.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She also makes lunches (refreshments) at the different schools that request her services.  She wishes to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like cookies and fruit, among others.

The members who are in the attached photo asked permission to arrive at the meeting late due to work.

Mary is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and is committed to making her repayments within the agreed period.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cookies and fruit, among others.

loans.name: Maria Angel

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives with her husband in her own house. She has a shop where she sells basic necessities: beans, milk, eggs, and bread among other things.

She has had her business for many years and this has given her experience in sales which means she earns better profits. It's located in her place of residence, it is very well known by the local residents and she has many customers so the shop is well stocked. 

She wants to grow the business and make a new investment  but she needs capital. For this reason she is applying for a loan to buy what she needs for her shop. She is sure that she will repay the debt, and at the same time trusts that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, soft drinks, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Meladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Meladis de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 7 años de edad y de esta forma contribuye con la economía y de su hogar. Desea terminar de construir un cuarto ya que lo dejó a medias por falta de recursos económicos. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra hierro, madera, cemento y lámina galvanizada para terminar el cuarto y poder contar con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Meladis, age 21, lives in her own house with her life partner and her little seven year old child.  She has been working as a domestic employee for seven years.  This way she contributes to the household finances.

She wishes to finish building a room that was left halfway done due to the lack of financial resources.  That is the reason that she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy iron, wood, cement, and galvanized metal sheets in order to finish the room and to be able to be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy iron, wood, cement, and galvanized metal sheets in order to finish building a room.

loans.name: Jayro Yanpol

texts.es:
Jayro trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el laboras alrededor de 9 horas al día y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo puede salir adelante casa día.

Jayro agradece la ayuda que le han brindado los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a este apoyo el podrá comprar una moto con la cual podrá desplazarse a su centro de labores y podrá ahorrar en movilidad ya que gasta mucho dinero en ir a su trabajo, de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jayro works as a farm laborer on a farm of his city. He works about 9 hours each day and with the proceeds of his humble work he can get from day to day.

Jayro is grateful for the help the kiva lenders have provided. Thanks to this support, he could buy a motorbike to travel to work and can save on expenses for mobility, as he had to spend a lot of money to go to work.

This way he will be able to continue striving to realize his great dream: "To have his own house."

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rosa Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa se encuentra reingresando al grupo de crédito Feria Libre, después de un tiempo que tuvo que salir de su grupo y ahora llega para continuar realizando sus créditos que le benefician en su vida diaria y porque comparte con sus amigas gratos momentos. Vive por la parroquia de Ricuarte en Cuenca, este lugar tiene hermosos paisajes por su geografía accidentada, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas solidarias que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros estan en el colegio, su esposo labora muy duro en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es herencia de sus padres.
Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero los días de feria en la ciudad se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, negocio en el que se encuentra desde hace 9 años. El dinero de su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de pescado y mariscos para su negocio. Su meta es seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is rejoining the credit group Feria Libre, after a period of time in which she had to leave her group.  Now she has come to continue asking for loans that benefit her in her daily life, and because she shares pleasant moments with her friends.  She lives in the Ricuarte parish in Cuenca, a place with beautiful scenery due to the rugged and uneven topography.  Its people work in agriculture, business, and raising animals.  They are supportive folks who still keep up the culture and traditions of their people.

Señora Rosa is 44 years old.  She is married and from her marriage has six children.  Three of them are already adults; they are married and live independently.  Her three single children are in school.  Her husband works very hard as a construction worker.  The house that they live in was inherited from their parents.

Doña Rosa works doing the chores in her home, but on market days she works selling fish and seafood in the city.  She has been in this business for nine years.  The money from her loan is going to be invested in the purchase of fish and seafood for her business.  Her goal is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora. María se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus compañeras del grupo de crédito Feria Libre, le gusta este tipo de créditos ya que les permiten estar un momento con sus amigas con quienes platican de varios temas de su interés. Vive por parroquia de Miraflores en Cuenca, este lugar tiene hermosos paisajes por su geografía accidentada, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas solidarias que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas están estudiando en la universidad y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión latonero, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María a más de dedicarse a sus hijos  labora todos los días y sin horario en la venta de artículos religiosos, tiene 10 años este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de artículos religiosos para su negocio. Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora María is currently taking out her second loan, along with her companions in the Feria Libre credit group.  She likes this type of loan because it gives them a moment together with their friends, with whom she can chat about various points of interest.  She lives in the Miraflores parish in Cuenca, a place with beautiful scenery due to the rugged and hilly topography.  Its people work in agriculture, business, and raising animals.  They are supportive folks who still keep up the culture and traditions of their people.

Señora María is 40 years old.  She is married and from her marriage has three children, ages 22, 19, and 5.  Her first two daughters are studying in the university, and her youngest child studies in a little school in the city.  Her husband’s profession is in auto body repair.  The house she lives in is her own.

Besides caring for her children, Doña María works every day, without a schedule, selling religious articles.  She has been in this business for ten years, and it has gone well for her.  She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of religious articles for her business.  Her goal is to enlarge her home.

loans.use: to buy religious items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su menor hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.
